column1: '''The Man in the Moon Came Down Too Soon''' is a [[Hobbits
column2: Hobbit]] poem of the [[Fourth Age]] said to derive from [[Gondorian]] lore. It was recorded in the [[Red Book]].<ref>{{AB

column1: The [[Man in the Moon]] had silver shoon
And his beard was of silver thread;
He was girt with pure gold and inaureoled
Clad in silken robe in his great white globe
With a crystal key, and in secrecy
He stole o'er a shadowy floor...<ref>{{AB

column2: Man in the Moon Came Down Too Soon, The]]
